reference_summary:
The Fifth Element (Remastered) [Blu-ray]
Bruce Willis  (Actor),     Gary Oldman  (Actor),     Luc Besson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
['Product Description', "New York cab driver Korben Dallas didn't mean to be a hero, but he just picked up the kind of fare that only comes along every five thousand years: A perfect beauty, a perfect being, a perfect weapon. Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Amazon.com', "Ancient curses, all-powerful monsters, shape-changing assassins, scantily-clad stewardesses, laser battles, huge explosions, a perfect woman, a malcontent hero--what more can you ask of a big-budget science fiction movie? Luc Besson's high-octane film incorporates presidents, rock stars, and cab drivers into its peculiar plot, traversing worlds and encountering some pretty wild aliens. Bruce Willis stars as a down-and-out cabbie who must win the love of Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) to save Earth from destruction by Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman) and a dark, unearthly force that makes Darth Vader look like an Ewok.", '--Geoff Riley']
{'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, Luc Besson, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.25 x 0.3 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3350191', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 17, 2007', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich, Chris Tucker', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai, Mandarin Chinese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'}

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** Movies, particularly in the action and sci-fi genres, with a growing appreciation for nostalgic comedies that evoke childhood memories.
- **Media Format Preference:** Strong preference for Blu-ray and high-quality remasterings, consistently seeking superior visual and audio experiences.
- **Rating Trends:** The user displays a tendency to rate highly (average rating of 4.8), reflecting a discerning taste for quality films and productions, recently enhanced by a five-star rating for a cherished childhood favorite.
- **Favorite Themes:** Enjoyment of unique and extravagant storytelling that blends adventure with fantastical elements, as well as narratives featuring nostalgia and humor, particularly those that resonate with childhood experiences.
- **Director and Actor Appreciation:** Shows notable preference for works by specific directors and actors, particularly Luc Besson and Bruce Willis, while also expanding interest to works featuring prominent comedy actors like Chevy Chase.
- **Review Behavior:** Engages in providing detailed, positive feedback emphasizing the emotional and sensory impact of films, especially regarding technical aspects like sound and visual quality; recent reviews highlight significant nostalgic value alongside technical merit.

This user is likely to continue engaging with similar media that prioritizes rich storytelling, high production values, quality remastering, and offers both adventure and nostalgic entertainment.
